column4: I have tried to dual boot Ubuntu 10.10 with Windows xp (it works, as long as I don't install Ubuntu to a seperate HD)
I have to install both OS onto the same HD to get the computer to dual boot, would like to install ubuntu 10.10 to its own hd
not sure my pentium 4 bios support this rvn
is the second hd a slave that can't be first to boot
the second hd is a slave with ubuntu installed
it shows up under the grup menu but will not boot
can you put the slave first in the bios?
have not tried to do this nit-wit did install windows xp first though
put the slave to be read first.
thx
will try this next time
assuming it has grub in its mbr.
not sure if grub is installed in the mbr
I installed xp first then ubuntu - telling it to install to the 2nd slave hd
does xp boot straight in without grub now.
again shows up in the grub menu - but will not boot
I installed both os s on one hd, now
and it works, with ubuntu 10.10 the default
gave up on installing unbuntu 10.10 to its own hd
okay, if you can get the slave first in the bios you could install there.
thx for the info
will try to get slave hd to boot first next go around
